subject: Philosophy
title: Functionalism
description: A micro-lesson that makes Functionalism usable.

hook.text: A calculator and a brain can both add. The hardware doesn't matter ‚Äî the function does.

buildup.text: Functionalism says mental states are defined by what they do, not what they're made of.

discovery.text: Pain is whatever plays the 'pain role' ‚Äî it's caused by damage and causes avoidance behavior.

twist.text: This means aliens or robots could have minds. If they function like us, they think like us.

climax.text: But critics ask: can function explain the feel of experience? Two systems might function identically yet feel different.

punchline.text: It's not what you're made of. It's what you do.

quiz.question: According to functionalism, what defines a mental state?
options: Its functional role, not its physical composition
